title: Authority of the griot and the epic of Sundiata

content.description: “I am a griot … we are vessels of speech; we are the repositories which harbor secrets many centuries old. Without us the names of kings would vanish into oblivion. We are the memory of mankind; by the spoken word we bring to life the deeds and exploits of kings for younger generations. … I teach kings the history of their ancestors so that the lives of the ancients might serve them as an example, for the world is old, but the future springs from the past.”
content.question: An African griot (storyteller), circa 1950, introducing the oral epic of King Sundiata of Mali, composed circa 1400 C.E.The introduction by the griot is intended to serve which of the following purposes?

choices.label: To establish the griot’s authority by connecting him to the past
To exalt the Malian kings above previous dynasties
To highlight the griot’s unique abilities as compared to other griots
To portray Mali as a progressive society that is improving on the past

content.answer: To establish the griot’s authority by connecting him to the past

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience.
